DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Global Health Version 1.2 Global08r In The Past 7 Days How Would You Rate Your Fatigue On Average Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the past 7 days about how they would rate their fatigue on average, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Global Health Domain In The Past 7 Days How Would You Rate Your Fatigue On Average Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses overall health in general, including global ratings of the five primary PROMIS domains (physical function, fatigue, pain, emotional distress, social health) as well as perceptions of general health that cut across domains._A question about an individual's rating of the average amount of fatigue they have felt in the past seven days._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses overall health in general, including global ratings of the five primary PROMIS domains (physical function, fatigue, pain, emotional distress, social health) as well as perceptions of general health that cut across domains.

Concepts.definition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses overall health in general, including global ratings of the five primary PROMIS domains (physical function, fatigue, pain, emotional distress, social health) as well as perceptions of general health that cut across domains.

Property.preferredName: In The Past 7 Days How Would You Rate Your Fatigue On Average Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A person's rating of the average amount of fatigue they feel.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: In The Past 7 Days How Would You Rate Your Fatigue On Average
Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's rating of the average amount of fatigue they have felt in the past seven days.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PROMIS:Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System, PROMIS Health Organization and PROMIS Cooperative Group, 2008-2012
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NRG Study in Rave per request by D.Grant. mc 6/14/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores for rating an individual's fatigue from 5: None, to 1: Very severe.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
